H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H6004.def: = process by which an object loses its ability to reflect light

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H6337.def: = {L:gold<SDBH:זָהָב>} refined to a high level of purity; ≈ considered rare, beautiful and very valuable

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H2789.def: = container ◄ made of baked clay; ► used for household activities, in sacrificial rituals, and for the storage of documents; ≈ regarded as of low value

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H2502.def: = causative action by which humans or animals partially or completely remove an object that used to be attached to another object

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H393.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H3283.def: = large bird with underdeveloped wings so that itcannot fly; it has a long neck and long legs and is about 2 meters tall; its head and neck are almost bald, being covered in short bristles; the male's body is black with long white feathers on its wings; its tail is white, gray, or light brown; the females are a uniform grayish brown; they feed mainly on seeds, fallen fruit, and shoots and may occasionally eat a lizard or a frog; they live in small flocks of about twenty, of which four or five are males; as many as ten females may lay their eggs in the one nest, but only one female and one male will incubate the eggs, with the female on the nest in the daytime, and the male taking over later in the afternoon; male ostriches make a series of deep booming hoots that can be heard great distances and which are often mistaken for the roar of a lion; ◄ |iStruthio camelus; |i*≈ associated with heartless cruelty because most females do not hatch their own eggs and do not take care of their own young

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4574.def: = things, such as food or certain events, that bring about extreme joy to humans

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H830.def: = heap of dung, ashes, and other garbage, ◄ probably located outside of a population center; ≈ associated with poverty and low status

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H5467.def: = town; ◄ located near {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}; ► town where {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} settled, when he separated himself from {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; destroyed with {L:Gomorrah<SDBH:עֲמֹרָה>}

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H5139.def: = a person who has been singled out for a position of leadership

H2141.def: = state in which an object is without any outward form of physical contamination

H7950.def: = frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

H6705.def: = state in which the skin of humans is extremely light in color ► to the extent that it reflects light

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H119.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color; ≈ often associated with beauty

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H1508.def: = an open space between different buildings that are part of one single complex

H5601.def: = (semi-)precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire

H8389.def: = the shape of (part of) the body of humans and animals; ≈ mostly used in contexts emphasizing the beauty of someone's face and figure

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H7815.def: = a black powdery or flaky substance produced by the incomplete burning of organic matter

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H2100.def: = process whereb liquids move freely as in a stream

H1856.def: = causative action by which humans thrust violently against other humans with a sharp weapon, ► with the aim of wounding them or ending their lives

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7362.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H1310.def: = process by which food is getting ready for consumption by being immersed in boiling water for a prolonged period

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H1262.def: = action by which someone consumes food; ≈ associated with special occasions such as mourning or sickness

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3341.def: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3247.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H5787.def: = state in which a person or animal is unable to see

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H1351.def: = action by which humans who have been enslaved regain their freedom, which is normally achieved by paying a price

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H5132.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H6836.def: = action by which humans watch a certain area waiting expectantly for something to happen

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H1814.def: = process by which an object is affected or consumed by fire

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4899.def: = a (non-eschatological) ruler appointed by God and anointed with oil by a prophet or priest

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3563.def: = small, bowl-shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6168.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}
